required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intra-Anally Administered Artesunate in Patients With High-Grade Anal Intraepithelial Neoplasia (AIN 2/3)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study of Intra-Anally Administered Artesunate in Patients With High-Grade Anal Intraepithelial Neoplasia (AIN 2/3)

brief_summary.textblock: This open label study investigates a novel non-surgical approach to the treatment of HPV-associated anal intraepithelial neoplasia, using Artesunate suppositories.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients diagnosed with AIN 2/3 will be enrolled sequentially in treatment cohorts receiving different doses of Artesunate suppositories administered trans-anally. Doses of escalation will be 200 mg, 400 mg, and 600 mg. Treatment cohorts will consist of 2 or 3 cycles at each dose level. Suppositories will be administered daily for 5 days. Five days constitutes 1 cycle. Up to 3 cycles will be administered at Weeks 0, 2, and 4.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be enrolled sequentially in each treatment cohort.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events (Safety and tolerability) of Artesunate suppositories for the treatment of anal intraepithelial neoplasia (AIN2/3)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks from the date of the first dosing
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with serious adverse events or dose limiting toxicities related to the study medication, according to CTCAE4.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with histologic regression of anal intraepithelial neoplasia (AIN2/3) to AIN1 or less
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with no AIN2/3 as assessed by high resolution anoscopy and biopsy

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with viral clearance of human papillomavirus (HPV) virus measured by HPV genotyping
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with HPV genotypes present at study entry which become undetectable during the study window

arm_group.description: Two five-day cycles of Artesunate suppositories, 200 mg/day
Three five-day cycles of Artesunate suppositories, 200 mg/day
Two five-day cycles of Artesunate suppositories, 400 mg/day
Three five-day cycles of Artesunate suppositories, 400 mg/day
Two five-day cycles of Artesunate suppositories, 600 mg/day
Three five-day cycles of Artesunate suppositories, 600 mg/day

intervention.description: Artesunate suppositories for the treatment of (AIN2/3) Anal Intraepithelial Neoplasia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Biopsy-confirmed high-grade anal dysplasia (AIN 2, AIN 3, HSIL) by high resolution anoscopy (HRA)
- Female of childbearing potential: negative urine pregnancy test
- Able to provide informed consent
- Patients who have the ability to collaborate with planned follow-up (transportation, compliance history, etc.).
- Weight ≥50 kg.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of low-grade anal dysplasia (AIN 1, LSIL) by high resolution anoscopy
- Known anal, vulvar, cervical, or penile cancer
- CD4 count < 200 at the time of consideration for entry into this study
- Unable to provide informed consent
- Currently receiving systemic chemotherapy or radiation therapy for another cancer.
- Patients who are on medical treatment with systemic immunosuppressants or steroids (e.g., active autoimmune disease)
- Extensive anal condyloma precludes the ability for the clinician to visualize HSIL during HRA

facility.name: University of Wisconsin Carbone Cancer Center
